content:
As a language model AI, I do not have personal beliefs or opinions, but I can give you an overview of the critical reception of The Used's latest album.

The Used's latest album, "Heartwork," released in 2020, has been described as an evolution of their sound rather than a radical departure from their previous work. However, it's considered a departure from the more angsty and heavy sound of their early work and adds elements of pop and electronic music to their repertoire.

Critics have lauded the album as a showcase of The Used's versatility and creativity, exploring new sounds while retaining their core identity. The album's guest features, including Jason Aalon Butler, Mark Hoppus, and Rivers Cuomo, have also been noted as a bold move for the band.

Overall, while "Heartwork" doesn't completely redefine The Used's sound, it shows a willingness to experiment and push boundaries within their genre.
